results.title: Using Key Value Store From Applications
results.summary: This section explains how to utilize the Spin key value store interface in applications, detailing operations like open, get, set, delete, and more. It provides examples in various programming languages including Rust, TypeScript, and Python.

results.title: Custom Key Value Stores
results.summary: This section describes how to customize Spin's key-value store, including changing the backing storage for the default store and adding additional stores through runtime configuration.

results.title: Granting Key Value Store Permissions to Components
results.summary: This section outlines how to grant access to key value stores for specific components in an application, ensuring that only authorized components can access the data.

results.title: Adding Variables to Your Applications
results.summary: This section explains how to add dynamic variables to a Spin application manifest, allowing for runtime configuration and easier management of secrets and API endpoints.

results.title: Using Variables From Applications
results.summary: Learn how to access and use application variables within your Spin applications using the Spin SDK across different programming languages.

results.title: Providing Variable Values
results.summary: This section details how to provide values for application variables from various sources, including secrets stores and environment variables.

results.title: Troubleshooting
results.summary: Common errors related to application variables in Spin and how to resolve them, ensuring proper configuration and access to required variables.
